question: What did the king love to do?
answer1: hunting wild beasts

question: How did the king feel about hunting wild beasts?
answer1: joy

question: Who did the king camp in the forest with?
answer1: hawk and hound

question: Who did the king see running through the forest before him?
answer1: a dwarf

question: What did the king do when he saw the dwarf?
answer1: spurred on his horse, rode after the dwarf, and seized him

question: How did the king feel about the dwarf's appearance?
answer1: surprised

question: What did the dwarf look like?
answer1: small and ugly, like a troll, and his hair was stiff as bean straw

question: Why did the king get angry?
answer1: The dwarf would return no answer, nor say a single word one way or another.

question: What did the king order his people to do?
answer1: seize the wild man and guard him carefully lest he escape

question: Why did the king's people say that only the king should guard him?
answer1: He should guard him so he does not escape.
answer2: The dwarf is of a sly and treacherous disposition.

question: What did the king have built?
answer1: a small house or cage built

question: Who took and kept the key?
answer1: the king

question: What did the king ask the queen to do?
answer1: rule the kingdom in his stead

question: Where did the king go?
answer1: far, far away to the other country

question: Why did the king have to leave?
answer1: A war broke out in the land and the king had to take the field.

question: Why did the wild man keep the apple of gold?
answer1: to get the little fellow to help him escape
answer2: ask the little fellow to free him

question: How did the little fellow feel when the wild man would not give the apple back?
answer1: sad

question: Why did the little fellow throw the apple in the cage again?
answer1: It seemed like a merry game to the fellow.

question: Why did the little fellow agree to set the wild man free?
answer1: The wild man had his apple.

question: When will the dwarf return?
answer1: When the prince is in need.

question: Where did the queen send people to look for the wild man?
answer1: over hill and dale

question: Why did the queen grow more and more unhappy?
answer1: She expected her husband to return every day.
answer2: the wild man had broken out

question: How will the king feel when he finds out the wild man had escaped?
answer1: upset

question: What did the king order?
answer1: a great investigation at his court

question: Why did the little prince come foward?
answer1: He could not hide the truth.

question: Why did the queen and the others turn white?
answer1: The little prince confessed.
answer2: They were fond of the little prince.

question: What were the men ordered to bring back as a sign that his command had been obeyed?
answer1: the boy's heart

question: Why did the people plead for the little prince?
answer1: They liked him.
answer2: They did not want him to die.

question: Why did the serving-men buy a pig?
answer1: all will believe it is the heart of the prince

question: What happened after the serving-men went back to the king's castle?
answer1: many people grieved

question: Why did the king's son climb the fir-tree?
answer1: see whether he could find a path anywhere.

question: What did the king's son see gleaming in the sun?
answer1: a large and splendid royal castle rising in the distance

question: How did he feel when he saw the castle?
answer1: very happy

question: Who did the king's son meet on the way to the castle?
answer1: a farm-hand

question: What job was the prince given when he reached the king's castle?
answer1: herdsman

question: What did the prince become when he grew up?
answer1: tall and brave

question: What kind of disposition did the king's only daughter have?
answer1: kind and cheerful

question: What happened because the princess had a swarm of suitors?
answer1: She said no to them all.
answer2: She wanted to marry the one who can ride up the hihg Glass Mountain in full armor.

question: Who will be the one to ride up the high Glass Mountain in full armor successfully?
answer1: the prince

question: Why was there no one who would not have liked to risk his life for the princess?
answer1: She looked so immeasurably lovely.

question: Why were none of the suitors able to ride up more than a little way?
answer1: The mountain was high, as slippery as ice, and was steep beyond all measure.

question: What happened when the suitors tried to ride up the mountain more than a little way?
answer1: They tumbled down again, head over heels.

question: What happened because the tumbling made so great a noise?
answer1: The tumult and the shouting could be heard far away.

question: What did the king's son do when he heard the tumult and the clashing of the arms?
answer1: sat down on a stone, leaned his cheek on his hand, and became lost in thought

question: Who was standing before the king's son?
answer1: the wild man

question: Why did the wild man appear?
answer1: to help the prince

question: How will the wild man help the king's son?
answer1: give the prince armor
answer3: tend to his oxen while he tries to go up Glass Mountain

question: Why was the prince so lonely and full of sorrow?
answer1: He was a fugitive from the land of his father.
answer2: He did not even have a horse and armor to ride up the Glass Mountain and fight for the princess.

question: What did the prince do when the wild man told him to ride out and try his luck?
answer1: did not wait to be told a second time
answer2: put on helmet and armor, buckled on his spurts, and hung his sword at his side

question: What happened when none of the princess's suitors had won the prize?
answer1: The princess's suitors were about to give up the contest.

question: Why did all ask who the knight might be?
answer1: None had ever seen him before.

question: What did the prince do when he reached the middle of the steep ascent?
answer1: flung around his steed and rode down again

question: How did all the people feel watching the strange knight?
answer1: excitement

question: Why was the king's daughter once more led up the Glass Mountain?
answer1: The princess's suitors decided to try their luck a second time.

question: What was the suit of armor given by the wild man forged from?
answer1: the clearest silver

question: Why were people's excitement even greater than the first time?
answer1: He was mysterious.
answer2: He was close to reaching the top.

question: How many times did the princess's suitors attempt to go up Glass Mountain?
answer1: three times

question: Why was the golden knight unknown?
answer1: He rode away into the woods right after.

question: How did people feel when the golden knight did not make his appearance at the castle?
answer1: surprised
